Posts.Content: reneeCA wrote: I just had a BMX on 11/23. I was a C cup with mild droop from breastfeeding and really wanted to go smaller, was not concerned wit lateral scars and so I chose the 1 stage reconstruction to avoid TE and 2nd surgery. I had to go to many PS in LA to find someone who "got it" that I wanted A/small B cups. I am 10 days post-surgery and very concerned that I am too large. PS said he used teardrop shaped 250ccs but I think I still look like a C. I am small build 5/10", 125 lbs and narrow build. Anybody else had small Direct to Implants? And how long do they take to settle into their permanent size? Much thx Dx 10/27/2016, DCIS, Left, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+ Surgery 11/22/2016 Lymph node removal: Sentinel; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): Silicone implant; Reconstruction (right): Silicone implant Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Direct to Implants seem too large reneeCA dtad

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2016 11:11PM reneeCA wrote: Hi Melee Ironically, I had no cording until I went to PT. I had 3 good sessions with the owner/therapist, then was sent to another MLD therapist in the office who performed very aggressive manipulation way under both armpits. The next day I had a cord that went from armpit to elbow. Later in the day, my prophylactic side (no nodes taken out) began to ache & I had stabbing pains when I moved it. Felt around and feels like a guitar string in there, too. Can you even get cording on side where no nodes were removed? I was able to get my arms to 105-120 degrees on each side. Now I am down to ~45 degrees with pain. Feeling defeated to say the least. Not sure if I can go back to PT. Maybe the cords were going to happen anyway but it feels like that one aggressive PT/massage made things worse.
Posts.Title: Did you have axillary web syndrome (cording) after ALND? mellee Fightingirl

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2016 01:59PM reneeCA wrote: Thanks! I did read elsewhere that direct to implant can seem very high on the chest for weeks to months. Do you know the ccs of your DTI?
